The Old Post Office

mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: From the day it opened in 1884, the Post Office in this building served as the main conduit for commerce and correspondence to and from all points west... This building was home to the Federal 8th Circuit Court, which grew to be the largest circuit in the nation by 1891. It covered ten states and four territories, and spanned 1,000 miles east to west... With jurisdiction over 11 million people by the end of the 1890s... -- http://www.oldpostofficestl.com/design_and_construction.php [work]
